alert.note: Alert for Laramie (Wyoming) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Cheyenne (Southeastern Wyoming and Western Nebraska)
info.headline: Flood Advisory issued July 20 at 9:13AM MDT by NWS Cheyenne
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL NOON MDT TODAY... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...Portions of Kimball County in Nebraska and eastern Laramie County in Wyoming including areas along Lodgepole Creek. * WHEN...Until noon MDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Rises in small streams and normally dry arroyos. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 906 AM MDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. Between 0.5 and 1 inch of rain has fallen. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Kimball, Pine Bluffs, Oliver Reservoir, Oliver Campground, Kimball Airport, Panorama Point and Bushnell. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads.
